clinical_validity.disease_label: hypogonadotropic hypogonadism 1 with or without anosmia
clinical_validity.gcep: Syndromic Disorders Gene Curation Expert Panel

generif.text: Identification of three novel mutations in the KAL1 gene in patients with Kallmann syndrome.
AL1 gene product, the extracellular matrix protein anosmin-1, is involved in FGF signaling
six novel and two recurrent intragenic KAL1 mutations in seven familial and four sporadic male cases of Kallmann syndrome
it is unlikely that KAL gene mutations are a clinically significant cause of sporadic GnRH deficiency in female patients
anosmin-1 may modulate the catalytic activity of uPA and its signalling pathway, whereas HS determines cell surface localization of the anosmin-1-uPA complex
a direct action of anosmin-1 on the migratory activity of GnRH neurons is shown

anosmin-1 is an isoform-specific co-ligand modulator of FGFR signaling that amplifies and specifies FGFR1 signaling responses during human nervous system development and defines the link between autosomal and X-linked Kallmann's syndrome
KAL1 gene has a closely related nonfunctional pseudogene on the Y chromosome
analysis of the biological function of anosmin-1 and its ability to interact with its three macromolecular ligands
Data suggest that the relative concentrations of Anosmin-1 and FGF-2 modulate the migration of oligodendrocyte precursors during development through their interaction with FGFR1.
Observational study of genotype prevalence. (HuGE Navigator)
The phenotype of renal agenesis/dysgenesis strongly indicates the existence of KAL1 gene defects in the genotype of patients with sporadic Kallmann syndrome.
KAL1 mutations result in a more severe reproductive phenotype than FGFR1/KAL2 mutations.
12% of Kallman syndrome males have KAL1 deletions, but intragenic deletions of the FGFR1, GNRH1, GNRHR, GPR54 and NELF genes are uncommon in Idiopathic hypogonadotropic hypogonadism/Kallman syndrome.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
binding of anosmin-1 to FGFR1 and heparin can play a dual role in assembly and activity of the ternary FGFR1.FGF2.heparin complex.

report describes 2 intragenic deletions of KAL-1 in 2 Kallmann syndrome (KS) patients & suggests KAL-1 deletion may be more prevalent in KS patients with other congenital organ abnormalities than those described previously from Northwestern China
KAL1 gene expression plays an important role in cancer metastasis and protection from apoptosis.
Anosmin-1 produced by epidermal keratinocytes in response to calcium concentrations or cytokines may modulate epidermal nerve density in atopic dermatitis.
Mutations of KAL1 underlie an autosomal dominant form of Kallmann syndrome.
Role of the KAL1 protein missense mutations in Kallman syndrome and in olfactory bulb development.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Two new mutations were detected in KAL1 from male patients with idiopathic hypogonadotropic hypogonadism.
A central role of KAL-1, in GnRH neuron ontogeny - specifically in GnRH neuronal migration from the cribriform plate area into the brain.

Comprehensive mutation analysis of all 7 known KS genes (KAL1, FGFR1, FGF8, PROK2, PROKR2, CHD7, and WDR11) in 30 well-phenotyped probands revealed mutations in KAL1 (3 men) and FGFR1 (all 5 women vs. 4/25 men), but not in other genes in Finland patients.
we report the case of a deletion of exons 4 to 14 (c.469-?_6314+?del) within the KAL1 gene in two related patients and in three female carriers among the members of the presented family.
The results of this study proposed that FGF-2 and Anosmin-1 are markers for the histopathological type and the level of inflammation of multiple sclerosis lesions
Peculiar prolactinomas in patients with pituitary developmental Kal 2 gene mutations
we demonstrate that missense mutations reported in patients with KS, C172R and N267K did not alter or substantially reduce, respectively, the binding to FGFR1
Increased presence of anosmin-1 in TGF-beta treated human retinal pigment epithelial cells cells, with distinct localization at the intercellular junctions.

Mutation analysis reveals a missense mutation of KAL1 in two brothers with Kallmann syndrome, while their mother is heterozygous for this missense mutation encoded by the single-nucleotide polymorphism rs2229013.

genetic association studies in population in Massachusetts: Data suggest that clinical features in Kallmann syndrome (KS) are highly associated with genetic causes: synkinesia is associated with genetic variations/mutations in KAL1.
These results indicate that intragenic multiexon deletions are one of the most frequent KAL1 abnormalities, which can be more accurately detected by multiplex ligation-dependent probe amplification.
No abnormalities were found in the patient group for the PROKR2 and GNRH1genes. In addition, no genomic rearrangements were identified in the healthy control individuals for the described genes
Anosmin-1 can facilitate tumor cell proliferation, migration, invasin, and survival.

Two brothers presented with a sensorineural hearing impairment associated with cryptorchidism and abnormal movements. Genome-wide array analysis identified a large deletion of KAL1 in both patients confirming the diagnosis of Kallmann syndrome.
Mutations were found in the following genes in one or more patients with congenital hypogonadotropic hypogonadism: KAL1, FGFR1, GNRHR, and CHD7
data indicated KAL1 plays potential suppressive role on OSCC initiation and progression. KAL1 gene may serve as adjuvant biomarker for identification of pathological grade.
anosmin-1 has been identified in other pathological scenarios both within (multiple sclerosis) and outside (cancer, atopic dermatitis) the central nerve system.
FGF receptor 1-mediated anosmin-1 activity plays a crucial role in the continuous remodelling of the adult olfactory bulb.

Anosmin-1 over-expression regulates oligodendrocyte precursor cell proliferation, migration and myelin sheath thickness. Data confirmed the involvement of (A1) works as a chemotropic cue contributing to axonal outgrowth and in oligodendrogliogenesis and its relevance for myelination.
Our analyses show that the two phenotypes in our patient are due to independent genetic defects: a genomic rearrangement involving the KAL1 gene and a point mutation of the steryl-sulfatase gene.

Results indicated that KAL1 may act as a putative tumor suppressor in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) and is inactivated by promoter hypermethylation. KAL1 may serve as a biomarker of malignant phenotype of HCC.
Kallmann syndrome with FGFR1 and KAL1 mutations was detected during fetal life

two novel variants, KAL1 (c.146G>T (p.Cys49Phe)) and mitochondrial tRNAcys (m.5800A>G), were identified in a large Han Chinese family with inherited Kallmann syndrome; although two variants can't exert obvious effects on the migration of GnRH neurons, they show a synergistic effect, which can account for the occurrence of the disorder in this family
Study reports 2 new mutations in KAL1 gene from patients with septo-optic dysplasia proven to be loss-of-function.

This study presents the first experimental evidence indicating a molecular interaction between anosmin 1 and PKR2. A truncated anosmin 1 protein comprising the first three domains of the protein interacts with the second extracellular loop of PKR2, involved in PK2 binding.

Hemizygous mutations were identified in three Kallman syndrome cases: a novel splice acceptor site mutation leading to skipping of exon 5 in the ANOS1 transcript in a patient with self-reported normosmia (but hyposmic upon testing); a recurrent nonsense mutation and a novel 4.8 Mb deletion involving ANOS1 and eight other genes (VCX3B, VCX2, PNPLA4, VCX, STS, HDHD1, VCX3A and NLGN4X) in KS associated with ichthyosis.
The prevalence of ANOS1 gene mutations is higher in familial Chinese Kallmann Syndrome patients.
ANOS1 expression shows continuous activation during the progression of colorectal cancer, its expression is closely related to the overall survival rate of patients.
A pathogenic variant was identified in the ANOS1 gene on the X chromosome: c.1267C>T, in 2 brothers who were hemizygous, and their mother, who was heterozygous for the variant.
Tumor protein p73 (TAp73) and kallmann syndrome 1 sequence protein (KAI1) expression levels are positively correlated in colorectal cancer.
Serum levels of ANOS1 serve as a diagnostic biomarker of gastric cancer: a prospective multicenter observational study.
The deleterious effect of this mutation on the transcriptional level of ANOS1 gene.
Genetics of hypogonadotropic Hypogonadism-Human and mouse genes, inheritance, oligogenicity, and genetic counseling.
ANOS1 variants in a large cohort of Chinese patients with congenital hypogonadotropic hypogonadism.", trans "ANOS1.
Mutation spectrum of Kallmann syndrome: identification of five novel mutations across ANOS1 and FGFR1.

name: anosmin 1
summary: Mutations in this gene cause the X-linked Kallmann syndrome. The encoded protein is similar in sequence to proteins known to function in neural cell adhesion and axonal migration. In addition, this cell surface protein is N-glycosylated and may have anti-protease activity. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
